item.title: Bicycle Friendly State Report Card - League of American Bicyclists
item.description: Every year the League of American Bicyclists issues each state a “Bicycle Friendly State” report card based on over 100 data points with input from state agencies and advocates. The 2019 report shows that out of 50 states, New Hampshire has slid down to a 36th place ranking and Maine to a 20th place ranking. No surprise that both states earned a “D” in infrastructure and funding. Join SABR’s advocacy committee by contacting Andy@seacoastbikes.

item.title: NEW BIKE/PED PATH ACROSS LITTLE BAY IS OPEN!
item.description: The new path provides a safe route for bicycles and pedestrians across Little Bay, between Dover and Newington/Portsmouth. This temporary Bike/Pedestrian pathway was constructed in response to many years of advocacy by SABR members to maintain bike/ped access during the reconstruction of the General Sullivan Bridge. NHDOT originally proposed a shuttle service, which SABR vehemently opposed. The emergency closure of the General Sullivan Bridge in September of 2018 necessitated NHDOT to develop a solution sooner than anticipated.

item.title: Advocacy
item.description: ADVOCACY (DRAFT) SABR was formed in 1992 as an advocacy organization to promote safe and effective bicycling networks in the Seacoast region of New Hampshire and Southern Maine. As a nall-volunteer group, SABR has poured our time and passion into advocating for local bicycle infrastructure and helping to incubate new biking initiatives. Get Involved button. Link to volunteer sign up Our current advocacy focus: General Sullivan Bridge – needs content

item.title: Membership
item.description: SABR is a nonprofit, volunteer organization that has been providing a unified voice for all kinds of bike riders in the Seacoast of New Hampshire and southern Maine since 1992. When you join SABR you are making a statement about your love of cycling! Membership comes in two flavors. Join for FREE and be part of the SABR community. Once you Join you can decide whether or not you would like to support us financially too!

item.title: Ride
item.description: RIDE! The greater Seacoast is an awesome place to ride your bicycle. Here are some resources to help you enjoy the ride! “How to” Video library Suggested Road Rides SABRides Cue Sheets Map My Ride Maine Bike Touring Site East Coast Greenway Mountain Bike Trails (keep as is) Rail Trails (link to ??) Races (take down Portsmouth Crit, add Raid Rockingham) Kids Rides (take down resources tab) Riding in the Cold (rename and keep page “In the Elements”)

item.title: About
item.description: About Us SABR is an volunteer run organization dedicated to making biking better in the Seacoast. Mission statement. Vision statement. The work (actually a labor of love!) gets done by dedicated people who share their talents and passion for biking. We’ve been around since 1992 and helped create significant improvements for local bicycling – be it new infrastructure (e.g. bike paths, bike bridges) and incubating new programs (e.g. VeloKids, Bike to Work Day).
